newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Formida on show at Informix seminars.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Formida on show at Informix seminars.

text.p: Software developer Formida Holdings Ltd said on Wednesday that a major database vendor, U.S-based Informix Software Inc, would use Formida software to present a demonstration to delegates at Informix's seminars on its new universal server database technology.

In a statement to the Australian Stock Exchange, Formida said Informix was the first of the major database vendors to provide an object-relational database that could be used to store and interact with content-rich data such as images, sound, video Web pages and maps.
Formida's software allows users of these databases to build end-user applications putting that data to work in client/server environments, the company said.

Formida said the Informix announcement was important because Formida was being recognised as an application development environment that was capable of working with the new object-relational database technology.
The Informix seminars are to be held in 18 North American cities and is likely to be extended to the Asia-pacific market, Formida said.

However, the company cautioned that while its involvement with the seminars was part of its strategy to work with key database suppliers, it should not be seen as a precursor to future contracts or indication of any future or formal relationship with Informix.
By 12.10 p.m. (0110 GMT), Formida shares were 15 cents higher at A$7.35 on light volume of 12,800 shares.
